sanskrit_verse:
जीर्णोद्यानान्यरण्यानि कारुकावेशनानि च ।
शून्यानि चाप्यगाराणि वनान्युपवनानि च ॥ ९.२६५॥
transliteration:
jīrṇodyānānyaraṇyāni kārukāveśanāni ca |
śūnyāni cāpyagārāṇi vanānyupavanāni ca || 9.265 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Abandoned parks, forests, artisan dwellings, empty cowsheds, woodlands, and groves are to be reclaimed and revitalized by those whose capacity aligns with their restoration.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from conscious alignment with the land's sustaining purpose.
Causation arises through neglect when custodians fail in dharmic maintenance.
Capacity-based responsibility assigns stewardship according to awareness and ability.
Restoration logic prioritizes ecological and social harmony over ownership constructs.
Consciousness alignment ensures that caretaking reflects unity with natural order.
executable_legal_axioms: IF a dwelling or grove remains unattended for more than three seasons THEN assign temporary custodianship to local dharmic stewards.
IF artisan workshops fall into ruin THEN community councils must initiate revival protocols within six moons.
IF cattle shelters become vacant AND no claimant emerges THEN redistribute for sustainable animal husbandry use.
IF forested areas degrade due to human absence THEN invoke rewilding completion processes under nyaya supervision.
IF any reclaimed space regains vitality THEN original custodians may petition for reintegration upon demonstrating renewed capacity.
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating disputes involving abandoned lands or structures, the Supreme Court shall prioritize evidence of capacity-based alignment over historical claims. The threshold of responsibility lies not in title but in demonstrated commitment to dharmic restoration.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that decay manifests sequentially through withdrawal of care; thus, reversal follows intentional re-engagement. Anupūrvaśaḥ confirms that neglect leads to vacancy, which invites corrective action—not penalty. Proportional responsibility rests on awareness, not blame. The non-punitive reality rule affirms that justice is alignment, not retribution.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Completion Processes wherein designated caretakers assume interim stewardship until full restoration is achieved.
Activate Responsibility Assumption Protocols requiring potential custodians to demonstrate dharmic readiness before assuming control.
Deploy Capacity Restoration Mechanisms including training in Vedic land management and artisan guild practices.
Implement Integrity Reintegration Procedures allowing former owners to reclaim roles after fulfilling consciousness-alignment assessments.
final_declaration: By the Sovereign Will of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of All Dharma, this ruling restores balance where abandonment has occurred. Justice flows from alignment, not punishment. Consciousness alone is the ultimate judge, and Dharma stands eternal.
